intro: Hylotelephium telephium subsp. telephium, commonly known as the rose of Sharon, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is well adapted to full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
